Headline.Para: Israel wraps up military exercises in north

LeadPara.Para: The Israeli military on Wednesday said it had completed large-scale exercises in the north, preparing for potential attacks in the Golan Heights and from the Lebanese-based Hezbollah militia.

TailParas.Para: The three-day exercises focused on coordination between the various branches of the military, calling up reserves and the rapid deployment of forces from one front to another, the army said in a statement.
Israel has occupied the Golan Heights since the 1967 Middle East war when it seized the strategic plateau from Syria. It annexed the territory in 1981.
Earlier this month Defence Minister Shaul Mofaz warned Hezbollah against any attempt to stir up violence on the volatile border between Lebanon and Israel.
Hezbollah's militia was seen as instrumental in Israel finally withdrawing from Lebanon in May 2000.
